title: Future Game Lookup - Next DayOfTheWeek
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team plays on a specific date in the future.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries

i.e. 
- What time is the teamName game on gameDate?
- When do the teamName play on dayOfTheWeek?
- Who do the teamName play on gameDate?
- Who do the teamName play next dayOfTheWeek?
- When is the teamName game this dayOfTheWeek?
custom_expected:
THEN user should be deep linked into the Gameday view of the corresponding team and date/day

*This will likely be the preview state of the game since the game should be in the future

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries 
AND the user asks when the teamName plays next dayOfTheWeek
(i.e. IF the current date is on 4/7, a Saturday)

i.e. When do the Yankees play next Friday?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user would get a response for game info for 4/13, next Friday

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries
AND the user asks when the teamName plays next dayOfTheWeek
(i.e. IF the current date is on 4/9, a Monday)

i.e When do the Yankees play next Friday?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user would get a response for game info for 4/20, next Friday

title: Future Game Lookup - On DayOfTheWeek
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team plays on a specific date in the future.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries

i.e. 
- Who do the brewers play ON Monday
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be deep linked into the Gameday view of the corresponding team and date/day

*This will likely be the preview state of the game since the game should be in the future

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries
AND asks for the same day as the current day
(i.e. IF current day is Thursday April 19)

i.e.
- When do the pirates play ON Thursday?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN it should deep linked into the Gameday view of the corresponding team for the current date/day
(i.e. Response of game info for current date Thursday, April 19)

i.e.
 mlbatbat://game?gameId=2018_04_19_pitmlb_phimlb_1

As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team plays on a specific date in the future.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:

custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be deep linked into the Gameday view of the corresponding team and date/day

*This will likely be the preview state of the game since the game should be in the future

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries
AND asks for the same day as the current day
(i.e. IF current day is Thursday April 19)

i.e.
- When do the pirates play THIS Thursday?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN it should deep linked into the Gameday view of the corresponding team for the next date/day
(i.e. Response of game info for next Thursday, April 26)

i.e.
mlbatbat://game?gameId=2018_04_26_detmlb_pitmlb_1

title: Future Game Lookup - No Game Scheduled
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team plays on a specific date in the future.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries
AND no game is scheduled for the day or date requested

i.e. 
- What time is the teamName game on gameDate?
- When do the teamName play on dayOfTheWeek?
- Who do the teamName play on gameDate?
- Who do the teamName play next dayOfTheWeek?
- When is the teamName game this dayOfTheWeek?
custom_expected:
THEN the response indicates that (currently text response is not implemented)
AND user should be deep linked into the Gameday view of the next scheduled game information for the requested team

*This will likely be the preview state of the game since the game should be in the future

title: Future Game Lookup - Cancelled or Postponed
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team plays on a specific date in the future.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries
AND the game was canceled or postponed for the day or date requested

i.e. 
- What time is the teamName game on gameDate?
- When do the teamName play on dayOfTheWeek?
- Who do the teamName play on gameDate?
- Who do the teamName play next dayOfTheWeek?
- When is the teamName game this dayOfTheWeek?
custom_expected:
THEN the response indicates that (currently text response is not implemented)
AND if the rescheduled game info is available, it has been provided to the user (currently text response is not implemented)
THEN user should be deep linked into the Gameday view of the corresponding team and date/day

*This will likely be the preview state of the game since the game should be in the future

title: Future Game Lookup - Team vs Team
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team plays another team on a specific date in the future.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries for a team vs another team

i.e. 
- When is the next time the teamName play the teamName?
- When do the teamName play the teamName next?
- When do the teamName and teamName play next?
- When is the next teamName teamName series?
- teamName teamName (ex: Yankees Mariners)
custom_expected: THEN the response should be deep linked into the Gameday view and correct game information is returned for the next time the two requested teams play each other

title: Future Game Lookup - Team vs Team, Teams Don't Play That Season
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team plays another team on a specific date in the future.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries for a team vs another team
AND the teams don't play that season

i.e. 
- When is the next time the teamName play the teamName?
- When do the teamName play the teamName next?
- When do the teamName and teamName play next?
- When is the next teamName teamName series?
- teamName teamName (ex: Yankees Mariners)
custom_expected:
THEN the response should indicates that

i.e. 
The Nationals are not scheduled to play the Dodgers this season.

title: Future Game Lookup - Team vs Team, Cancelled or Postponed
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team plays another team on a specific date in the future.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries for a team vs another team
AND the game was canceled or postponed 
AND if makeup game info is available

i.e. 
- When is the next time the teamName play the teamName?
- When do the teamName play the teamName next?
- When do the teamName and teamName play next?
- When is the next teamName teamName series?
- teamName teamName (ex: Yankees Mariners)
custom_expected:
THEN the response should be deep linked into the Gameday view and correct game information is returned for the next time the two requested teams play each other
and if available correct makeup game information is returned for the requested teams

title: Future Game Lookup - Home / Away Game
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I want to ask BAMbot when the next time my favorite team plays at home or away
NOTE: timing should be related to the timezone where the game is played, games starting at or after 5:00 PM are night games

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries for a team's next home game

i.e. 
- When is the next teamName home game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be deep linked into the Gameday view, this will likely be the preview state of a game in the future
AND the correct game date/time/location is returned to the user and it's actually the next game on their schedule that meets the specified criteria (home)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks future game info related queries for a team's next away game

i.e. 
- When is the next teamName away game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be deep linked into the Gameday view, this will likely be the preview state of a game in the future
AND the correct game date/time/location is returned to the user and it's actually the next game on their schedule that meets the specified criteria (away)

title: Present Day Game Lookup - Preview
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I'd like to ask BAMbot when my favorite team is playing today.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks present day game info related queries
AND game has not started yet (in Preview state)

i.e. 
- When do the teamName play today?
- When do the teamName play tonight?
- When do the teamName play?
- When is the teamName game tonight?
- What time is the teamName game today?
- What time is the teamName game?
- What time is the teamName game tonight?
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to corresponding Scoreboard date which displays matchup and time

============================================================

The behavior below is not yet implemented due to SDBB-635
THEN user should be deep linked into the Gameday preview page of the corresponding team on the current game

title: Present Game Lookup - Home Game
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
When the users asks if a team is playing today
AND the requested team is playing a home game in the present
custom_expected:
THEN the template should use the word host or vs.

i.e. 

- The Nationals host the Mets...
- Tune into their next game vs. the Mets...

title: Present Game Lookup - Away Game
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
When the users asks if a team is playing today
AND the requested team is playing an away game in the present
custom_expected:
THEN the template should use the word visit or at

i.e. 

- The Nationals visit the Mets...
- Tune into their next game at the Mets...

title: Won Past Game - No Day/Date Specified
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot if my favorite team won their most recent game.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks won the teamName game
AND not day or date is specified

i.e. 
- Who won the teamName game?
- Who won the last teamName vs teamName game?
- Who won the teamName vs teamName game?
custom_expected:
THEN the user should be deep linked into the Gameday wrap view
AND correct game information is returned when user asks about the score of a certain game
AND if applicable the most recent time that team1 played team2

title: Won Past Game - Day/Date Specified
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot if my favorite team won their most recent game.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks won the teamName game
AND either a day, date, or time frame is specified

i.e. 
- Who won the teamName game last night?
- Who won the teamName game yesterday?
- Who won the teamName game last night?
- Who won the teamName game on date?
custom_expected:
THEN the user should be deep linked into the Gameday wrap view
AND correct game information is returned when user asks about the score of a certain game

title: Won Past Game - No Game on Requested Day/Date
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot if my favorite team won their most recent game.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks won the teamName game
AND neither a day, date, or time frame is specified

i.e. 
- Who won the teamName game last night?
- Who won the teamName game yesterday?
- Who won the teamName game last night?
- Who won the teamName game on date?
custom_expected: THEN the user is provided with game info from the next closest game prior to the date they requested

title: Starting Pitcthers - Date/Day Specified
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I'd like to ask BAMbot who is pitching for my favorite team on a specific date.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about the starting pitchers for a game on a specific date

i.e.
- Who is pitching/starting pitcher/probable pitcher for the teamName tonight/today?
- Who is pitching/starting pitcher/probable pitcher for the teamName on dayOfTheWeek?
- Who is pitching/starting pitcher/probable pitcher for the teamName on date?
- Who was the teamName pitcher/starting pitcher/probable pitchers on currentDate?
- Pitcher/Starting pitcher/Probable pitcher for the teamName on today's date
- Who are the pitchers/starting pitchers/probable pitchers for dayOfTheWeek's teamName game? (i.e.: Who are the starting pitchers for Thursday's Nationals game?)
custom_expected: THEN the user should be deep linked into the Gameday view which displays correct game and starting pitcher information

title: Starting Pitcthers - Date/Day Not Specified
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I'd like to ask BAMbot who is pitching for my favorite team when no date is specificed

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about the starting pitchers for a game
AND no date is specified

i.e.
- Who is pitching/starting pitcher/probable pitcher for the teamName
- Who was the teamName pitcher/starting pitcher/probable pitchers?
- Pitcher/Starting pitcher/Probable pitcher for the teamName
- Who are the pitchers/starting pitchers/probable pitchers for teamName game?
custom_expected:
THEN the user should be deep linked into the current date's Gameday view which displays correct game and starting pitcher information
and fall back to the next scheduled game if no game is scheduled for the current day

title: Starting Pitchers - Game Not Scheduled that Date/Day
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I'd like to ask BAMbot who is pitching for my favorite team on a specific date.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about the starting pitchers for a game on a specific date
AND there is no game scheduled for that date/day

i.e.
- Who is pitching/starting/probable pitcher for the teamName tonight/today?
- Who is pitching/starting/probably pitcher for the teamName on dayOfTheWeek?
- Who is pitching/starting/probable pitcher for the teamName on date?
- Who are the pitchers/starting pitchers/probable pitchers for dayOfTheWeek's teamName game? (i.e.: Who are the starting pitchers for Thursday's Nationals game?)
custom_expected: THEN the user should be deep linked to game info from the next scheduled game

custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query who the winning pitcher was for a game on a specific date

- Who was the winning pitcher from the teamName game on date?
- Winning pitcher for teamName game on dateLastYear (i.e. March 7, 2017)
custom_expected: THEN the user should be deep linked into the Gameday wrap view which displays correct game and winning pitcher information for the requested date

title: Score - Live Game

As a baseball fan, I'd like to ask BAMbot what the score of my favorite team's currently ongoing game is.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks the team score
AND the game is live

i.e.
- Who is winning the teamName game?
- Who is winning the teamName game?
- What is the score of the teamName game?
- What is the score of the teamName vs teamName game?
- Are the teamName leading the game?
custom_expected: THEN the user should be deep linked into the live Gameday view where the correct game score and game status is returned to the user

title: Score - Past Game Score, Team vs Team Matchup
custom_preconds:
As a baseball fan, I would like to ask BAMbot who won the last matchup between two specific teams.

GIVEN the user is on Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks either
- who won the last matchup between two specific teams
OR
- the score of a final game for a specific team vs team

i.e.
